intro: Xylosma dussii, commonly known as the African xylosma, is a shrub or small tree native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Tiliaceae and is characterized by its small, ovate leaves that are usually opposite in arrangement. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by woody, capsule-like fruits. Xylosma dussii is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
